subject: RE: [junit] random testing with JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Yes, this occurred to me after I posted my response to your message :-) In a nutshell, try the following in order: - Run your tests over all possible
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold

> I think we're in agreement here

Yes, this occurred to me after I posted my response to your message :-)

In a nutshell, try the following in order:

- Run your tests over all possible values of your data.
- If it's not possible, pick a subset of this sample and make sure that if
the test fails, you will be able to reproduce the failure. This can usually
be achieved even if you are using a random generator.

> This is a
> reasonable thing to do, but it's not something that JUnit really lends
itself to.

Really? I was thinking that suite() would let you do that pretty easily.

--
